conclusion: Determine the distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air.
Bullet is fired from Cart A with speed v0 relative to the ground.
Cart A is moving to the left with speed v1.
Bullet's speed relative to Cart A is v0 + v1.
Bullet's speed relative to the ground is v0.
Gun fires a bullet every Δt0.
Distance traveled by bullet in time Δt0 is s1 = v0 Δt0.
Cart A moves to the left with speed v1.
Cart A travels a distance sA = v1 Δt0 to the left.
Cart B moves to the right with speed v2.
Cart B travels a distance sB = v2 Δt0 to the right.
Relative speed of Cart B with respect to Cart A is v2 + v1.
Relative displacement between Cart A and Cart B in time Δt0 is s2 = (v1 + v2) Δt0.
First bullet travels towards Cart B when fired.
Second bullet is fired after Δt0 and travels towards Cart B.
Distance between two bullets in the air is the difference between their positions after the second bullet is fired.
First bullet has traveled a distance v0 Δt0 when the second bullet is fired.
Carts have moved a relative distance (v1 + v2) Δt0 when the second bullet is fired.
Distance between two bullets is s = v0 Δt0 - (v1 + v2) Δt0.
Distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is (v0 - v1 - v2) Δt0.
